RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 1 5F Turf CR: 81. Claiming Purse 17500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $17,500, if for $15,000, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FLY CONDOR showed early speed then settled in hands into a stalking position, stalked the early pace until three eighths pole where she started to gain ground, was encouraged at the quarter pole, was driven while chasing after the leader, cleared the early leader at the sixteenth pole and drew off to win by one and a quarter lengths. BIDOFHONEY vied for the early lead, took the rail and matched strides with another competitor, set the fractions, showed he way until the sixteenth pole where she was caught by another foe and settled for second. SAMMIES SAMURAI was well off the pace early on, was cued at the three sixteenth pole while racing in the three path , gained ground and continued to close while racing in the four path, passed a tired leader and was able to capture third place honors. FROSTY BREW vied for the early lead in the three path, matched strides with another rival racing along the rail, co led and set the pace with this foe until the stretch, tired . NON BINDING was never involved. STORMY SUNRISE showed little.

ENTRY.NAME: Fly Condor
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, in hands, rail, angled out stretch, drew off on cue

ENTRY.NAME: Sammies Samurai
ENTRY.OWNER: Tom Swearingen Racing Stable and Caras Dean

ENTRY.NAME: Bidofhoney
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, set the pace, led in a set, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Frosty Brew
ENTRY.OWNER: Mazoch Linda Mazoch Michael J and Gustafson Austin
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied ,matched ,led ,set pace, 3w, keen in the bridle early, tired

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 2 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 83. Allowance Purse 29000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 3 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $20,000 Or Less Not Considered In Al lowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MO BLING vied for the lead and took the rail spot, settled in hands and set a false pace, continued to show the way into the stretch, was threatened by a closing foe on the outside, angled out to meet that threat, leaving the rail open, where HANNAH'S HAVEN took advantage of the rail and passed taking the lead, MO BLING quickly angled back towards the rail and battled for her lead, dug back in and found enough to take her lead back and win the race by a head. MO BLING raced giving a super competitive, winning effort. HANNAH'S HAVEN stalked the early leaders while saving ground, rated for the first half of a mile, inched up closer to the lead and patiently waited behind horses for racing room until after the quarter pole, seized the opportunity, passed up the rail at the sixteenth pole, took the lead, found a charging MO BLING battling next to her, battled back but MO BLING had the momentum from charging back across the track to meet HANNAH'S HAVEN, where HANNAH'S HAVEN tried but just missed, settled for second. MAGNA COLORS raced off the pace three wide, started gaining ground at the half mile pole, edged out into the four and five paths circling the field in the turn was in contention at the quarter pole, was encouraged and pushed down the stretch, struggled to switch leads and finished third. COURTLY DOC stalked the eventual winner from the three path while racing in hands, advanced in between horses to challenge for the lead, had pressure for both the inside and outside while launching her bid at the five sixteenth pole, then tired by the quarter pole. FUHR MEO raced wide through out and was never involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Mo Bling
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, led, rail, set a false pace, collared 16th, battled back

ENTRY.NAME: Hannah's Haven
ENTRY.COMMENT: stlkd, in hands, behind horses, patiently waited, battled, short

ENTRY.NAME: Courtly Doc
ENTRY.OWNER: Estate of Jerry D Cart and Lanasa Jr Marion
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalkd, 3w, in hands, btwn, challenged 5-16th, tired 1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Magna Colors
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, 3w, advanced 1/2, 4-5w, circled, closed, left lead

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 3 7 1/2F Turf CR: 79. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE JUNE 3, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since May 3, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at one mile and seventy yards).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FREIGHTRAINFREEMAN raced four wide early on, gained ground with a steady long stride along the backside, tucked behind horses and saved ground in the turn, inched in towards the rail at the quarter pole, was in contention but still behind until the sixteenth pole, found room on the rail was cued and responded with a good turn of foot racing up the rail clearing the early leaders and getting up for a game win. CALLINGINTHENIGHT raced in the two path and in between foes, matched strides with another rival while setting the early fractions, was joined by an outside competitor after the five furlong pole, raced through the turn and into the stretch in a set of three, shook the rival to the outside, was passed by a hard charging inside rival and came out with second place rights. EGO was off a touch slow, was allowed to settle and find his stride while being well off the pace, saved ground, closed up the rail with a well timed clean trip, closed with conviction, up for third. SILENT TAP vied for the early lead, took the rail, set the pace, was joined and matched strides with two other foes and battled until the sixteenth pole, was caught by an inside closer, tired late. I'M D'CAT made no impact. SOURNOIS was off the pace, saved ground while racing along the rail, mild gain late. WEDINGTON vied for the lead, stalked just off the pace while racing three wide, launched bid stretch but gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Callinginthenight
ENTRY.OWNER: Cascio Andrew J and D and F Horse Farms
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2w, btwn, matched, pace, 4 wide, stretch, battled, up for second

ENTRY.NAME: Wedington
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied, stalked, 3w, launched bid, gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Ego
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, trailed, found his stride, closed rail 1/4, up for 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Freightrainfreeman
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w, off pace, steady gain, saved grd turn, 2w, clsd,upintime

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 85. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE JANUARY 3, 2023. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 3, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THE FEATURE stalked the early pace from the three path, started to gain ground after the three eighths pole, continued to build momentum while being lightly encouraged in the stretch, collared the early leaders at the sixteenth pole was pushed and driven past those rivals to willingly draw away for the win. LAUGHINGSAINTSSONG stalked the early leader until half mile marker, joined and matched strides on the outside while racing three wide, shook the inner most foe at the sive sixteenth pole, continued battling through the stretch with the same rival, was caught by a late closer to the outside but held o for second. SHARK HARBOR vied for the early lead, took the rail trip, set the early fractions in company with another rival, battled until the sixteenth pole where these two leaders were both caught by the eventual winner, kept battling but didn't have enough and settled for third. JAZZ IT UP staked the early runners, raced along the rail, was keen in the bridle early, was asked to relax and bring his head down while waiting behind horses, shuffled back a bit and showed little after that. SUCH was no menace. MR. PRIORITY trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Jazz It Up
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, rail, keen, steadied, shuffled back, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: The Feature
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 3w, launched bid 5-16th, challenged 16th, drew away

ENTRY.NAME: Laughingsaintssong
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, matched, battled, up for second

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 5 5F Turf CR: 88. Claiming Purse 18500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 3, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000, if for $17,500, allowed 2 lbs. (If deemed inadvisable by management to run this race over the turf course, it will be run on the main track at Five Furlongs).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ATTA PARTY was stalking the early leader from the two path, was on the bit and resisted rating, pulled himself next to early leader who raced along the rail, willingly matched strides with this foe through the turn, shook this rival in the upper stretch, was joined by an inside attacker, battled with this rival, was cut loose and drew off leaving the inside rival behind, was full of run and gamely took this win. CREME DE BALI was racing mid pack along the rail, was asked to patiently wait, rated, tucked in behind horses until the rail opened up moving into the stretch, was given the cue, passed up the rail and closed with a nice turn of foot, not enough for the win but a game second. WILTON was fractious in the gates, was off a step slow, raced off the pace, made one steady run, four wide at the half mile pole, circled the field in turn, was in contention and six wide at the eighth pole, not enough. OCEOLA was three wide, vied for the lead, stalked the pace just off the leader, challenged briefly with a mild bid. BURNINHUNKOFLOVE made no impact. KAHAAL was never involved. BRAHMS BOY showed early speed and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Creme de Bali
ENTRY.COMMENT: mid pack, rail, well timed trip, passed up the rail, 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Wilton
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gates, off slw, off pace, 4w-6w, closed

ENTRY.NAME: Atta Party
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked, 2w, on the muscle, bid, battled, drew off

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 6 5F Dirt CR: 64. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GET OUT TONIGHT wire to wire. KANCANCUTIE raced off of the pace, made one run and closed was up in time for second. GUEST IN MY HEART was off slow, closed, did not have enough. CINCO QUINCE showed early speed, flattened out. OUR CUSTOM DARLING raced mid pack and had no late kick. THURSDAY MORNING made no impact. HALF SCOUT trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Cinco Quince
ENTRY.OWNER: Tri-Star Racing LLC and Cimarron TTT Farms LLC

ENTRY.NAME: Kancancutie
ENTRY.OWNER: Murrah, Mike and Wright, Jack B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, closed, up for second

RACE.RACE_TEXT: LOUISIANA DOWNS RACE 7 7F Dirt CR: 93. Starter Allowance Purse 15000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE STARTED FOR A CLAIMING PRICE OF $5,000 OR LESS IN 2021 - 2023. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since May 3, 2023 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since January 3, 2023 Allowed 4 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CRYPTOZONIC raced off the pace, stalked at the half, took command at the eighth and drew off for the win. AZTAR took the early lead, set the pace, was stalked by an outside challenger, battled with outside foe and gave way, settled for second. AVAILABLE STAR was off a bit slow, raced from off the pace, made one run, closed but it was not enough today. POST CLOSE maintained position through out. WITT'S TAQUITO ran even, mild bid. JOHNNYSJOURNEY flashed early speed, faded. GALLANT STAR trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Available Star
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, off pace, closed, not enough

ENTRY.NAME: Cryptozonic
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace, stalked 1/2, commanded 1/8 drew off
